page.title: 14Horse Ledge Point
page.content: To the south of Shanklin is{Horseledge {Point.}We explored Horseledge point, there were lots of rockpools. In the rockpools there were lots of sea anemones. They eat lots of prawns. Their tentacles can sting when they are open. We saw some crabs. A crab starts life in a shell. Then it breaks out of its shell and scuttles along the beach. On the rocks and in the pools are many different kinds of seaweed. The green seaweed is called sea lettuce. The red seaweed is called Phycodrys Rubens and has oak shaped leaves. The brown seaweed is flat with air bubbles to keep it afloat. These are also called Wracks. Horseledge is very rocky. Limpets cling to the rocks with a very strong foot. They are many in number.{It is a {dangerous,place to visit when the tide {is coming in.
